* A passionate and fun culture. We love what we do, and we believe in having fun while doing it. Our workplace is diverse, inclusive, and filled with exciting activities — from hackathons to team activities, company trips, and even board game nights. At Bannerflow, creativity and success go hand in hand with a lot of fun.
* A stable, global leader with a constantly evolving Product Based in Stockholm, Bannerflow is a well-established company with a solid financial foundation and a rapidly growing international customer base. Our product is continuously evolving to meet the shifting needs of our customers, and we are committed to expanding into new markets with ambitious growth goals.


**🦋 Are you + Bannerflow = true?**
 We are seeking an experienced and driven Product Owner to join one of our agile feature teams.
   

  

 In this role, you will break down the product vision and roadmap into actionable deliverables, taking full ownership of the backlog. You will prioritize and prepare user stories with clear acceptance criteria to guide your development team. Collaboration is key, and you will work closely with cross-functional teams, other Product Owners, and Engineering Managers. Your contribution will be vital in fostering a highly efficient and motivated team where everyone feels a strong sense of purpose.
   

  

 Additionally, you will serve as the voice of the customer and domain expert within your area, ensuring that development aligns with user needs and expectations. You will contribute to key product metrics, such as feature adoption and usage, to measure the impact of your work and guide future development. Furthermore, you will share best practices through support articles, onboarding presentations, and tips, driving adoption and usage of your features.
   

  

**So, what are we looking for?**
* 3+ years of experience working with software products, ideally within a SaaS environment, with additional experience in the advertising industry being a plus.
* A strong sense of ownership and personal drive to create impactful products.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills — you thrive in a team environment and know how to bring people together to achieve great things.
* Experience in managing backlogs and making tough product decisions while balancing innovation and speed.
* A passion for understanding user needs and translating them into effective solutions.
* An ability to navigate a rapidly changing environment, staying adaptable and proactive.


 We believe that our employees are the key to our success and we are dedicated to building a positive and supportive work environment where our employees can thrive and grow. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team and welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities. To support our employees, we offer a competitive compensation package and inclusive benefits, including pension (ITP1), healthcare insurance, and parental leave top-up.
   

  

**If you’re ready to take your career to the next level and be a part of our exciting journey, we want to hear from you!**

title: Azure tekniker
description:
Är det du vi söker?
   

  

 Som Azure Cloud Tekniker hos oss kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i vårt team, arbeta nära våra kunder och arkitekter i en mängd olika och stimulerande projekt. Din uppgift blir att medverka i leveransen av molnbaserade infrastrukturlösningar. Tillsammans med våra arkitekter kommer du att bygga, implementera och förbättra Azure-baserade lösningar, såsom att flytta applikationer och hantera andra delar av projekt och kunduppdrag. Du och ditt team ansvarar för att implementera nya funktioner och tekniska lösningar inom Azure för våra kunder.
   

  

 Vad vi förväntar oss av dig:
   

  

* Erfarenhet inom IT-infrastruktur, med fokus på Azure eller andra molnlösningar.
* Teknisk kompetens inom Microsofts infrastruktur- och plattformstjänster i Azure.
* Van att arbeta med IT-infrastruktur och molnlösningar.
* Förmåga att kommunicera väl på engelska i både tal och skrift.


 Personliga egenskaper vi tror på för att trivas i rollen:
   

  

* En proaktiv och positiv inställning.
* Starkt intresse för Azure, med en önskan att ständigt lära och utvecklas.
* Förmågan att arbeta självständigt och i team.
* Ansvarsfullhet och en positiv syn på samarbete.
* Entusiasm för att utforska och implementera nya lösningar.
* Motiveras av projekt som gör skillnad för både företaget och kunderna.


 Om B3 Cloud: Som experter på molnteknik och framtidens digitala arbetsplats, assisterar vi våra kunder i att övergå från traditionell infrastruktur till molnet. Vi erbjuder analyser, planering, migrering och förvaltning av IT-miljöer. Vi hjälper även kunder att uppnå modern samverkan och effektiv informationsdelning med Microsoft 365. B3 Cloud är en stolt Guldpartner och Cloud Service Provider (CSP) till Microsoft.
   

  

**Är du intresserad?** 
 Kände du igen dig i beskrivningen och är redo för en ny utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan nu och låt oss berätta varför B3 borde vara din nästa arbetsgivare! Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post, men vid frågor, kontakta Melinda på melinda.andersson@b3.se.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om förmånerna hos oss? Här är några:
   

  

* Konkurrenskraftig lön.
* Frihet att styra din egen arbetsdag.
* Stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling.
* Interna utbildningar genom Cloud Skolan.
* Årliga konferensresor, sommar- och julfester.
* Regelbundna sociala aktiviteter, allt från After Works till frisbeegolf.


**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
*Som en del av B3-koncernen, är B3 Cloud rankad som Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, utsett till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022 och 2023, samt vann utmärkelsen Årets Karriärföretag 2022. Vi lever efter våra värdeord: erfarenhet, mångfald och energi, och satsar på hållbarhet i alla led. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre och har därför B3 Team som anordnar aktiviteter inom wellness, från yoga och löpning till musikquiz och föreläsningar om stresshantering och mental hälsa.*

title: Senior Product Manager Terminal Operations & Performance
description:
**About Us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Instabox and Budbee - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands - Budbee, Instabox and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with our people, the merchants and our consumers at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans to stop anytime soon. As we continue to expand our product offering to new merchants and geographic regions, our logistical network and operations are getting increasingly complex.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Senior Product Manager for Terminal Operations & Performance you will be responsible for all aspects of terminal solutions, terminal flows and processes ensuring high quality and efficient operations in 30+ terminals across 6 countries. You will be responsible for setting the vision and strategic direction together with your team for our product solutions. You’ll prioritise and secure both quality and operational excellence in our terminals ensuring sustainable and scalable solutions that enable growth. The area covers sorting, loading and unloading, vehicle management, scheduling, workforce management, training & development
   

  

**Your Tasks Will Include, But Are Not Limited To**
* Setting the vision and strategic direction for the terminal operation product domain
* Leading the work of defining and implementing the Instabee way of working across terminals
* Lead the work of prioritising and securing roadmap deliveries meets company quality and efficiency goals
* In collaboration with regional & terminal management secure operational flows and process are adopted and used
* Creating the conditions for our employees to develop, succeed and create results


**What We Are Looking For**
* We believe you are a inspiring leader that is passionate about creating flows, process and user experiences that are easy to understand
* You have a good understanding of what is needed to build, introduce and ensure the success of processes and product solutions in a blue collar environment
* You have solid collaborative skills and are good at building relationships and teamwork with internal stakeholders
* Challenging goals are a motivator and you are passionate about building both a successful business and team
* We see that one of your strengths is your thorough ability to assess complex flows and identify key improvements both at a big picture and detailed level


**More About You**
* Solid strategic communication & leadership skills
* Track record of driving progress in complex flows and environments
* Stabil systematic skills and the ability to break down strategic goals to actionable pieces
* About 10 years of experience in relevant area for the role


**Beneficial For The Role**
* Product Development
* Management Consulting
* Blue Collar Environment
* Project Management
* Manager
* Business & Performance Steering
* Logistics


**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
**Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:**
 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
   

  

 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
   

  

 🍸 Rooftop Fridays: Chill out at our Friday rooftop bar with the best views in town.
   

  

 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
   

  

 ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
   

  

 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care
   

  

 and love to your little one.
   

  

 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee (Instabox/Budbee) in Sweden.*
 Instabee was founded in 2022 after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox and Porterbuddy. Instabee is present in six countries, serving thousands of online merchants, including ASOS, Zalando, Inditex and H&M and is on track to become the most admired European e-commerce enabler.
   

  

 Since the start, Instabee has focused on consumer-centric and sustainable solutions, offering deliveries to boxes and homes using muscle power, electricity, renewable diesel and biofuels. Through bespoke technical solutions, Instabee can guarantee optimal fill rates and routing, minimising any unnecessary transports. Instabee is backed by Kinnevik, Creades and EQT, among others.

title: Sales Executive
description:
Cision employs the brightest, most passionate people in the tech industry. We’d love for you to join our growing team! We invest in our people through training and professional development while supporting you along the way—all so you can meet your career goals. To us, the most important measure of our success is yours.
   

  

*Do you want to work with one of the most innovative tech companies within the Earned Media landscape? We are looking for a Swedish and English speaking Sales Executive that wants to be a key player in our growth journey via consultative sales towards the Finance- and PR industry* 
 .
   

  

**The role**
 As a Sales Executive at Cision, your responsibilities encompass the entire sales cycle, from prospecting, contract negotiation to client onboarding towards the Nordic market. Your main focus will be in customer acquisition with frequent contacts with prospects and clients in Sweden. You will be working towards C-suite level executives, Communications directors, PR-managers and marketing directors in most industries. Business meetings are performed using tools for virtual meetings, although in normal circumstances most meetings are performed face to face with our prospects and clients. The role in question is part of an experienced sales team with a handful of results-oriented individuals who strive to achieve individual and team goals.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 We are looking for a person who has previous experience in sales and who is passionate about driving the entire sales process from start to finish. We believe that you are a business- and goal-oriented person with an interest and knowledge in media, PR/communication and finance. We also believe that you are a performance-oriented and curious individual who strives to exceed your own and your team's goals.
   

  

**Requirements**
 A post-secondary education in communication, economics, finance or equivalent
   

  

 You communicate freely in Swedish and English in both speech and writing.
   

  

 1-2 years of work experience in software/tech sales
   

  

**Meritorious**
 Experienced in B2B sales
   

  

 Experience in worked towards an individual sales budget
   

  

*We constantly Evolve ¤ We celebrate ¤ We embrace differences ¤ We are one ¤ We are dedicated*
**Does this sound like a next step in your career?**
 Submit your application as soon as possible as we review applications on an ongoing basis.
   

  

**Other**
 Start: Immediately
   

  

 Salary: Fixed + Commission
   

  

 Location: We are located in beautiful premises centrally at Odenplan, with good communication
   

  

**#Sweden**
 As a global leader in PR, marketing and social media management technology and intelligence, Cision helps brands and organizations to identify, connect and engage with customers and stakeholders to drive business results. PR Newswire , a network of over 1.1 billion influencers, in-depth monitoring, analytics and its Brandwatch and Falcon.io social media platforms headline a premier suite of solutions. Cision has offices in 24 countries throughout the Americas, EMEA and APAC. For more information about Cision's award-winning solutions, including its next-gen Cision Communications Cloud®, visit www.cision.com and follow @Cision on Twitter.
   

  

 Cision is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all employees can be their authentic selves and perform at their best. We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion is vital to driving our culture, sparking innovation and achieving long-term success. Cision is proud to have joined more than 600 companies in signing the CEO Action for Diversity & Inclusion™ pledge and named a “Top Diversity Employer” for 2021 by DiversityJobs.com .
   

  

 Cision is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or other protected statuses.
   

  

 Cision is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. In keeping with our commitment, Cision will take the steps to assure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. Accordingly, if reasonable accommodation is required to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of the position, and/or to receive all other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact hr.support@cision.com
   

  

 Please review our Global Candidate Data Privacy Statement to learn about Cision’s commitment to protecting personal data collected during the hiring process.

title: Customer Facing MLOps Engineer
description:
* Application Deadline: Oct. 15, 2024
* On-site


**Job Description**
 Oriola is a health and wellbeing company operating in the Nordic countries. We are driven by our purpose, Health for life and we have set ambitious sustainability targets to support wellbeing of people, society, and planet. To ensure this, our business keeps evolving. We are growing and developing within health and wellbeing and developing our services. Our significant role in society gives a great purpose for working with us. In return, we expect you to aim as high as we do. You will need to be customer oriented and proactive. Together we work towards an even healthier future.
   

  

**About The Position**
 Who are YOUR day to day stakeholders ? Industry leaders in the Drug Manufacturing world, Pharmacies , Internal Business units - Commercial, Supply Chain, Advisory etc.
   

  

 Our
 **Data** 
 is monetized. Communication is key. You will be a customer-facing ML-Ops engineer who is responsible for not only designing, building, and maintaining but also directly engaging with our external customers and internal stakeholders to understand their data needs, provide solutions, and offer technical support. This role requires a blend of technical expertise and strong interpersonal skills to ensure that clients' data requirements are met effectively while maintaining a positive relationship.
   

  

**Skills & Requirements**
**Technical Skills**
* Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) Skills
* Model Deployment and Serving: Experience with deploying machine learning models in production environments. Proficiency with tools like Docker, Kubernetes, TensorFlow Serving, TorchServe, and MLflow.
* CI/CD for ML: Knowledge of setting up the (CI/CD) framework and practices tailored for ML projects. Familiarity with tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, and CircleCI.
* Monitoring and Logging: Skills in monitoring model performance and logging, using tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, and ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana).
* Model Versioning and Governance: Experience with model version control, reproducibility, and compliance, using platforms like DVC (Data Version Control) and MLflow.
* Automated Testing: Knowledge of automated testing frameworks for ML, including unit tests, integration tests, and model validation.
* Data Engineering Skills
* Data Pipeline Development: Proficiency in building and maintaining scalable data pipelines using tools like Apache Airflow, Apache NiFi, or Luigi.
* ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) Processes: Strong understanding of ETL processes and tools such as Apache Spark, Hadoop, Talend, or Informatica.
* Database Management: Experience with both relational (SQL) and NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra). Ability to design and optimize database schemas.
* Data Warehousing: Familiarity with data warehousing solutions like Snowflake or Azure Synapse.
* Data Cleaning and Preprocessing: Skills in data wrangling, cleaning, and preprocessing using Python (Pandas, NumPy) or R.
* Data Security and Governance: Knowledge of data security practices, GDPR, and data governance tools and frameworks.
* Programming and Scripting
* Programming Languages: Proficiency in Python and SQL. Knowledge of Java, Scala, or R can be beneficial.
* Scripting: Experience with shell scripting (Bash) and automation scripts to streamline workflows.
* Cloud Computing and Infrastructure
* Cloud Platforms: Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform (GCP) for deploying and managing ML models and data pipelines.
* Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Familiarity with IaC tools like Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, or Ansible for automating infrastructure deployment.
* Containerization and Orchestration: Proficiency with Docker and container orchestration tools like Kubernetes for scalable deployments.


**We Offer You**
* Meaningful work in purpose driven organisation, Health for life
* Great team spirit and fun colleagues from Sweden and Finland
* Interesting forward leaning organisation with high ambitious for sustainability
* Organisation which gives independency and responsibility to develop Organisation with Scandinavian view and some travelling
* Interesting business in the middle of the health industry from B2B service business to B2C customer relations.


**Terms Of Employment**
* This is a permanent full-time position, and we want you to start asap
* This position is based in Stockholm, Espoo or Gothenburg
* The Employment is within the Oriola Group – below you can read about our great company


**Application:** 
 We will start recruitment interviews with the applicable candidates already during the application period. We hope to hear from you soon!

title: Client Executive SMB
description:

 As a Client Executive SMB, your role is central to the company's continued growth journey where you will create new business opportunities by exploring the SMB market, mainly in Sweden.

title: SAP EWM Solution Architect
description:
If you enjoy working with high-calibre people on interesting projects in a thriving partnership organization, Westernacher is the place to be!
   

  

 To complement our team in
 **Sweden** 
 , we are looking for an

**.**
**Your Responsibilities**

* Take responsibility for the planning and implementation of EWM projects
* Configure SAP EWM incl. doing tests, writing documentation and performing validation

title: Tax Compliance Regulatory Counsel - Partner management
description:
**Build your future with Sovos.**
 If you're seeking a career where innovation meets impact, you've come to the right place. As a global leader, Sovos is transforming tax compliance from a business requirement to a force for growth while revolutionising how businesses navigate the ever-changing regulatory landscape.
   

  

 At Sovos, we're dedicated to more than just solving compliance challenges – we're committed to making a positive and lasting difference in everything we do. Our teams operate on the modern edge of digital technology, working not only to solve complex business challenges but also to enrich our personal, professional, and local communities.
   

  

 Our purpose-built systems provide the tools you need to thrive in a world where governments demand increased visibility, faster reporting and greater control over business processes. Excited about the possibilities? So are we!
   

  

 Don’t worry if you don't check all the boxes – apply anyway! We're focused on hiring the right people, not just the "right" resume. It's not about what you've done elsewhere; it's all about what you're capable of doing here.
   

  

**The Work You'll Do**
 The Regulatory Liaison Counsel - ISVs and Embedded Partners will play a critical role in supporting and growing Sovos’ global ISV ecosystem and revenue stream by engaging with the Sovos partner ecosystem and supporting their needs as they look to Sovos for ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements in their solution portfolios and customer implementations. This position combines the expertise of a Regulatory Counsel, requiring deep knowledge and ongoing involvement in the processes of the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, with the role of a liaison officer dedicated to facilitating partners’ access to the broader regulatory function within Sovos. This role reports to the VP of Regulatory Analysis and Design.
   

  

**More Specifically You Will**
* The Regulatory Liaison Counsel is responsible for bridging the gap between Sovos' regulatory expertise and its strategic ISV partners, ensuring seamless integration of relevant compliance aspects of Sovos solutions in various markets.
* Partner closely with Sovos functions managing the business and technical aspects of relationships with ISV partners to ensure satisfaction of partners’ compliance needs within the scope of Sovos software solutions.
* Maintain accountability for a ‘regulatory helpdesk SLA’ that allows Sovos partners to act with confidence, ensuring timely and appropriate Sovos regulatory input towards their customers.
* Ensure a deep understanding of Sovos Regulatory Affairs and broader interaction with public authorities on an ongoing basis.
* Work continuously with Sovos Alliances, Sales Engineering, Product Management, and other relevant functions to develop and maintain a robust understanding of Sovos’ partner ecosystem and the specific business processes and associated compliance needs that arise in that context.
* Represent the requirements of Sovos ISV and embedded partners in the evolving scope and day-to-day execution of regulatory monitoring, design, and affairs in close collaboration with colleagues in the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, as well as with Regulatory Affairs, Business Analysts, Product Managers, and other Sovos colleagues involved in designing, building, implementing, supporting, and maintaining Sovos solutions.
* Act as an integral part of the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, internalizing contextual and factual knowledge that allows the Regulatory Liaison Counsel to act as independently as possible in their key role towards Sovos partners while also maintaining an excellent understanding of roles, responsibilities, and time allocation for partner support within the larger Regulatory Analysis and Design Department.
* Support the VP of Regulatory Analysis and Design and their teams to ensure optimization of resources in support of all relevant Sovos functions and help them with time and resource planning towards that goal.
* Explain complex tax rules in clear language for both tax and non-tax professionals, internally and externally.
* Support Partner Marketing by providing tax-centric marketing material and participating in webinars.
* In collaboration with Sovos Marketing and partner management functions, participate as a Sovos regulatory thought leader and subject matter expert in Partner events, advisory boards, and publications.


**What We Need From You**
* Juris Doctor (JD) degree or equivalent master’s degree in law, finance, or accounting.
* Proficiency in legislative tracking and tax research techniques.
* Experience in working within and a deep understanding of the enterprise software market, including the value-add of different categories of enterprise software to size and geographic segments in the business sector.
* Experience in working with and deep understanding of businesses’ financial, logistical, administrative, and IT processes and strategies.
* A strong affinity for and proven ability to communicate effectively with professionals in information technology, data science, and computer-assisted business processes.
* Strong team orientation with a history of working collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent research, analysis, and writing skills.
* Ability to read, interpret, and understand tax-related postings and documents.
* Ability to generate and interpret functional and high-level technical design content as it pertains to compliance and business processes.
* Self-motivated with a strong drive to succeed.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize activities.
* Additional language skills are strongly preferred.
* Minimal travel required to Sovos locations and events.


**What Does Sovos Offer You?**
 The tools to enhance your life - because we want you to enjoy your life outside of work and inside!
   

  

* An opportunity to work with a global team
* Flexible within the UK, Germany, Sweden, Netherlands, or Portugal.
* Bi-Weekly Meeting Free Days!
* Mentoring Programs
* Globally recognised Training and Development programs
* Benefits


 Sovos is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that celebrates diversity and where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate against race, colour, religions, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic provided by law. At Sovos, all employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work.
   

  

**Company Background**
 Sovos is a global provider of tax, compliance and trust solutions and services that enable businesses to navigate an increasingly regulated world with true confidence. Purpose-built for always-on compliance capabilities, our scalable IT-driven solutions meet the demands of an evolving and complex global regulatory landscape. Sovos’ cloud-based software platform provides an unparalleled level of integration with business applications and government compliance processes.
   

  

 More than 100,000 customers in 100+ countries – including half the Fortune 500 – trust Sovos for their compliance needs. Sovos annually processes more than three billion transactions across 19,000 global tax jurisdictions. Bolstered by a robust partner program more than 400 strong, Sovos brings to bear an unrivaled global network for companies across industries and geographies. Founded in 1979, Sovos has operations across the Americas and Europe, and is owned by Hg and TA Associates. For more information visit http://www.sovos.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter .

title: R&D Engineer - HVDC Insulation Design
description:
**Description**


Are you passionate about pioneering advancements in energy technology? Do you want to be part of a team that is driving the global transition towards a sustainable future? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you at Hitachi Energy. Our Technology & Solutions Development (business R&D) organization within HVDC is at the forefront of innovation, and we are looking for talented individuals to join us in Ludvika, Sweden.


For over 60 years, HVDC technology has been a cornerstone in the energy market, enabling the integration of renewable energy sources and supporting the transition to a more sustainable and reliable energy system. At Hitachi Energy, we are committed to developing cutting-edge solutions that address the world’s energy challenges. Our HVDC technology is crucial for connecting renewable energy sources to the grid, ensuring efficient and reliable transmission of electricity over long distances.


As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work on groundbreaking projects that make a real difference. You will be part of a collaborative and inclusive work environment where your ideas and expertise are valued. We believe in fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement, and we provide our employees with the tools and resources they need to succeed.


Discover more about our world-leading technology at www.hitachienergy.com/HVDC.

**Your Responsibilities**

* Join a world-class team to develop new solutions for high voltage electrical insulation applications in HVDC.
* Perform electric field calculations using advanced software like COMSOL and ANSYS, handling complex mechanical geometries.
* Utilize your expertise in high voltage testing to participate in dielectric tests, analyze results, and plan testing strategies.
* Work with the latest HVDC technology to develop new solutions or improve existing ones.
* Collaborate with colleagues worldwide, contributing to our latest HVDC technology and solutions.
* Be an integral part of a global team, working closely with colleagues to achieve common goals.

**Your Background**

* A master’s degree or PhD in a relevant technical discipline related to high voltage techniques and insulation.
* Proficiency in Matlab and programming tools such as Python, C++, or similar languages.
* Experience with electromagnetic field software like COMSOL, ANSYS, or similar.
* You have ability to work well in a team, with attention to detail and accuracy.
* You have a strong interest in technology and a willingness to share your knowledge.
* A strong problem-solving mindset and endurance to deliver and document high-quality technical solutions.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks
* More benefits could be connected to this specific role

**Additional information**


Are you ready for an exciting new challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Welcome to apply for this position!

**Recruiting Manager, Pankaj Roy,** Pankaj.roj@hitachienergy.com will answer your questions on the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. Any other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Ingrid Schjelderup, Ingrid.schjelderup@hitachienergy.com


You will be based in Ludvika, Sweden & we offer flexible working – from – home options. Other flexible possibilities can be discussed prior written agreement is signed. Office location in Ludvika, Sweden is in the quite small but in this business famous town. Located in the centre of Sweden, about two hours’ drive from Stockholm. A calm city, close to nature with forest and lake areas where you can amuse yourself with activities all year around.
company_description: Advancing a sustainable energy future for all

title: Entry Level Function Verification Engineer - Human Centric
description:
*Volvo Cars is on a mission to bring traditional car manufacturing into a connected, sustainable, and smart future. They have bold ambitions in innovation, safety, and electrification. Within the Safe Vehicle Automation (SVA) department, Volvo Cars lead the way in setting the industry standard for AD and ADAS function development, designing and verifying the complete vehicle solution for autonomous cars and active safety functions.*

**The team**


You will be a part of the Human Centric AD/ADAS group that design and verify functions like Road Sign Information, Driver Alert, and Connected Safety. Within the Human centric group there are a variety of different competences where some focus more on the HMI aspect and others are more focused on requirements and verification.


You will be a part of a team of experienced engineers with many years of experience in the area that you will have excellent opportunities to learn from. There are no silos within SVA as many of the teams have areas that overlap with each other – quite often there are collaborations across the teams in the department as well as with external suppliers.


**The role**


In this role you will enjoy a high degree of variety with both theoretical and practical tasks. You will get to experience and influence first-hand how the future AD/ADAS features will work and feel.


Together with your colleagues you will define functional requirements and use data for insights. You will also verify and validate features in different test environments such as vehicles, HIL (Hardware-In-the-Loop) and SIL (Software-In-the-Loop).


As part of the role, you will have the opportunity to go on expeditions outside of Sweden to test the features in different driving environments.


You will also work in close collaboration with external software suppliers and internal interfacing teams.


Examples of tasks:


* Define function requirements
* Verify features in car, HIL and SIL
* Plan, set up and execute test sessions

Analyse test results  

* 

  

**Your profile**


You get things done. You love learning and enjoy sharing your knowledge with others. You have a strong interest in and curiosity about technology and are eager to use data to inform development.


You’re willing to help out with tasks, even those you're less familiar with. You are an experienced driver with a strong interest—perhaps even a passion—for vehicles.


* Recently finished your Bachelor´s or Master´s degree in Mechatronics, Electronics, Engineering Physics or similar field
* Swedish B drivers license
* Interest in vehicles and/or automotive industry

Proficient English language skills, Swedish is considered a plus  

* 

  

Bonus:


* Python or other scripting language

**Talent program**


This position is a part of Hubbau's talent program and is a collaboration between Hubbau and Volvo Cars. During the 12 months of the talent program, you will be employed by Hubbau and work as a consultant in your specific role at Volvo Cars. The ambition is for your employment to smoothly transition to a permanent position at Volvo Cars thereafter. The goal is to provide you with an even more rewarding first year that sets you up for success at Volvo Cars and in your future career. The talent program offers training sessions from specialists within Vinngroup to build up your knowledge base.


**Start date**


Autumn 2024 or early 2025


**Other information**


The position is a full-time employment located at Volvo Cars office in Torslanda, Göteborg. We practice ongoing selection, so do not hesitate to express your interest.

title: Entry Level Function Verification Engineer - Autonomous...
description:
*Volvo Cars is on a mission to bring traditional car manufacturing into a connected, sustainable, and smart future. They have bold ambitions in innovation, safety, and electrification. Within the Safe Vehicle Automation (SVA) department, Volvo Cars lead the way in setting the industry standard for AD and ADAS function development, designing and verifying the complete vehicle solution for autonomous cars and active safety functions.*

**The team**


The team consists of two groups where one part is focused on function design, and the other on verification and validation and both are managed by the same Product Owner and Engineering Manager. The team has 18 members, with a relatively even split between the two groups. It includes a mix of experienced professionals and newer graduates, fostering a dynamic balance of ambition and expertise.


The group is diverse, both in terms of nationality and professional backgrounds and they aim to keep an atmosphere that is both caring and supportive.


**The role**


For this position we focus on the verification and validation role. In this role you will enjoy a high degree of variety with both theoretical and practical tasks. You will get to experience and influence first-hand how the future AD (autonomous drive) features will work and feel.


The role is practical, hands-on and involves coordinating and troubleshooting software, integrating it into the car, and running software tests. The work often takes place in cars or test platforms (HIL rigs), but does not involve actual test driving, it focuses more on preparations and software integration testing.


Together with your colleagues you will define functional requirements and use data for insights. You will also verify and validate features both in vehicles and HIL (Hardware-In-the-Loop).


Regardless of which area you primarily work in, you can rotate between focus areas depending on the needs of the organization.


**Your profile**


To work in this team, you should have proficiency in Python and like to work hands-on. Troubleshooting and resolving issues is exciting to you and you have the ability to follow through but most importantly the eagerness to learn and take initiative.


We also want you to:


* Recently finished your Bachelor´s or Master´s degree in Mechatronics, Electronics, Engineering Physics or similar field
* Have knowledge of communication protocols like CAN or CANoe is a big bonus
* Be fluent in English, Swedish is meritorious
* Swedish driver's license
* Interest in vehicles and/or the automotive industry

**Talent program**


This position is a part of Hubbau's talent program and is a collaboration between Hubbau and Volvo Cars. During the 12 months of the talent program, you will be employed by Hubbau and work as a consultant in your specific role at Volvo Cars. The ambition is for your employment to smoothly transition to a permanent position at Volvo Cars thereafter. The goal is to provide you with an even more rewarding first year that sets you up for success at Volvo Cars and in your future career. The talent program offers training sessions from specialists within Vinngroup to build up your knowledge base.


**Start date**


Autumn 2024 or early 2025


**Other information**


The position is a full-time employment located at Volvo Cars office in Torslanda, Göteborg. We practice ongoing selection, so do not hesitate to express your interest.

title: AI Engineer / Lead på TechSeed
description:
*På TechSeed är vi övertygade om att det är tekniken som kommer göra världen till en bättre plats. Vi ser ett stort behov i vårt samhälle att kombinera affärsförståelse, digitalt ledarskap samt innovativa arbetssätt och lösningar med framtidens tekniker i uppkopplade ekosystem. Vi tror på en hållbar framtid med säkra lösningar genom exempelvis IoT-lösningar, digitala tvillingar, AI och cybersäkerhet. Det här är vårt WHY och det fyller oss med energi varje dag. Det här är vår arena.*


TechSeed är ett medarbetarägt bolag som erbjuder konsulttjänster och har ett kompetensdjup inom flera domäner. Vi är på en kraftig tillväxtresa och söker nu Business Intelligence Developers som även kommer få en stor grad av inflytande och insyn i hur vi växer framåt och tar ett helhetsgrepp om uppkopplade ekosystem och lösningar. Vi söker dig som trivs i konsultrollen och samtidigt vill bidra till att skapa vägen framåt för TechSeed – Tillsammans.


Som AI Engineer / Lead på TechSeed kommer du att arbeta som konsult i samarbete med våra kunder samt arbeta internt för att driva vårt AI-arbete framåt. Som en del av TechSeed Data Insights kommer du att bidra till att företag kan fatta välgrundade beslut genom att dra nytta av insikter från AI, ML, IoT och traditionell Business Intelligence. Hos Data Insights hittar du engagerade och kunniga kollegor med kompetens inom data strategi, arkitektur, data engineering, AI/ML och rapportering. Som delägare och anställd kommer du vara med i utvecklingen av våra erbjudanden, få möjlighet att påverka de områden som du drivs av och samtidigt få tryggheten av ett team med gemensamt mål och gemensamma intressen.


Vår grund ligger i att vi delar med oss av vår passion för teknik och värdet vi skapar. Det handlar bland annat om kunskapsutbyte och att dela idéer, bidra med god stämning såväl som att skapa värde genom vårt delägarskap. Vi erbjuder dig:

* Inflytande i hur vi bygger TechSeed tillsammans
* En öppen kultur där vi värdesätter olikheter, insikter och innovationer
* Direkt värde från våra finansiella resultat genom bonus och delägarskap
* Möjligheten att växa in i olika tekniska områden / ansvarsområden utifrån dina önskemål
* Flexibelt arbete hemifrån, beroende på uppdragets behov.

**Vem söker vi?**


Vi söker efter dig som vill hjälpa våra kunder hitta nya innovativa sätt att nyttja AI-teknik och har en förmåga att förenkla det komplexa. Du är analytisk, har ett inre driv och genuint intresse för att den tekniska utvecklingen inom AI och intelligent automation.


I rollen som konsult kan uppdragen variera beroende på vilka erfarenheter du har med dig och vilka ambitioner du har för framtiden, men våra grundkrav för rollen är att du har minst **5 års arbetslivserfarenhet som Data Engineer, Data Scientist eller Software Development**, samt minst 2 års erfarenhet av implementationer av AI/ML och goda kunskaper i exempelvis Python-


Det är även meriterande om du besitter kunskap inom:

  

* Verktyg inom intelligent automation t.ex. Power Automate, UiPath, Blueprism
* API och integrationer
* Projektledning
* Microsoft Azure


Eftersom vi arbetar med flera typer av kunder med olika behov krävs det för rollen att vara obehindrad i både svenska och engelska, tal och skrift. Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att jobba på ett start/scale-up samt har tidigare konsulterfarenhet.

**Om TechSeed**


Vi är ett medarbetarägt konsultbolag i ScaleUp-fasen med visionen att skapa värde med uppkopplade lösningar. Vi tror på kombinationen av nära samarbeten, framtidens tekniker och att gemensamt arbeta för att skapa ett bolag vi verkligen trivs på. Genom att erbjuda delägarskap till våra anställda ger vi möjligheten till insyn och påverkan, samtidigt som det gynnar samarbeten och att prioritera vad som är bäst för gruppen. Detta speglas både i vår kultur och våra erbjudanden, där vi kombinerar vårt stora tekniska intresse med ett kundanpassat förhållningssätt samtidigt som vi har många sociala aktiviteter och en härlig gemenskap på kontoret. Vår arena är uppkopplade ekosystem, där tekniker som IoT och Intelligent Edge används för att skapa uppkopplade tjänster och system inom ekosystem som Smart Cities, Smart Factories, Smart Companies och Smart Buildings.

title: Field Service Engineer Remote Nordic, EMEA
description:
**Work Schedule**


Standard (Mon-Fri)**Environmental Conditions**


Strong Odors (chemical, lubricants, biological products etc.), Will work with hazardous/toxic materials**Job Description**


Job Title: **Engineer III, Field Service, Nordic & EMEA**


Being part of Thermo Fisher Scientific, doing bold work, and joining a team that values performance, quality and innovation. As part of a successful, growing global organization you will be encouraged to perform at your best. With revenues of more than $35 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our people the resources and chances to create significant contributions to the world.

**Location/Division Specific Information**


Location: Field Nordic, Remote / Field EMEA Remote

**Division: Laboratory Automation**

**Discover Impactful Work**


The main focus of the role is repair, maintenance and installation of Cytomat Products, Laboratory Automation (LAI) products and selected 3rd party equipment at customer sites in Demark and across Europe. A second strong priority is passionate about customer relations’ activities intended to generate sales Customer Support Services and Service Contracts to customers in this engineer’s area.

**A day in the Life:**

* Schedule and Perform on-site maintenance, repair and installation on all Cytomat Products and other LAI system components and instrumentation.
* Perform on-site training relative to system service, maintenance, and basic operation.
* Keep track and maintain your local spare part's inventory
* Ensure that all documentation related to in-house and on-site support activity is completed accurately and submitted on a timely basis. This includes maintenance of electronic files, Field Service Reports, Service Work Orders and Quotes.
* Diagnose problems over the phone and/or using remote software. Where vital, follow up with on-site work or dispatch third-party service providers for on-site work. Follow up to ensure problems were resolved to the customer’s happiness.
* Actively supervise the status of contract, warranty and time and material installed customers.

**Keys to Success**

**Education**


Technology diploma in Mechatronics, Electro-mechanical engineering, Electrical or Mechanical engineering, or equivalent.

**Experience**

* Minimum 5 years practical experience in field service or solving software and lab equipment
* Validated experience with automation, robots, and/or device instrumentation.

**Knowledge, Skills, Abilities**

* System-level diagnostic skills using inquiries, observations, system schematics & documentation, software tools, and communications / electrical diagnostic aids
* Multi-disciplinary technical skills / excellent with software, electrical, and mechanical systems
* Computers, serial communications, and software - comfortable with general use of computers, adept with serial communications cabling, Network diagnostics, and have at least a rudimentary knowledge of programming languages to be able to read a program and understand the logic.
* Wiring and pneumatics (schematics, PLCs, power panels)
* Mechanical systems (CAD drawings, fasteners)
* Working proficiency of Momentum software features and operations is a plus.
* Excellent interpersonal communication skills, must have a professional working proficiency in English, additional languages helpful.


You will receive a competitive salary, company car, company pension scheme and will have outstanding development and career prospects in a globally growing company. Apply today!


Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We are also an equal opportunities organization.


Watch as our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us. As one team of 100,000+ colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. #StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued.
company_description: At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our professionals develop critical solutions—and build rewarding careers.

title: Engineer III, Field Applications
description:
**Work Schedule**


Standard (Mon-Fri)**Environmental Conditions**


Standing for full shift**Job Description**


Job Description: Engineer III

**Job Title: Field Services Engineer**


When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment, or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have a real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals!

 **Position Summary:**


We are searching for a dedicated Service Engineer to repair, install, and update all Thermo Fisher hardware and automation products under the BEA division, along with consulting at customer sites.

 **Key Responsibilities**

* Provide instruments and equipment services, including installation, basic training, preventative maintenance, repair, and compliance services.
* Chip into high-value service-related procedures and documents.
* Work closely with other departments to improve customer experience.
* Help to cultivate customer satisfaction through ensuring prompt customer response times and problem resolution.
* Provides up-to-date service reporting on customer activities.
* Perform commissioning and qualification of equipment by completing Site Acceptance Test (SAT) and Installation/Operational Qualification (IQ/OQ) Protocols.
* Developing and maintaining positive relationships with customers in assigned territory.
* Help Service Sales Representative on service orders.
* Support product quality improvement.

**Education/experience:**

* Bachelor’s degree or above, major in computer technology, E/E, Automation, or biology, chemistry is preferable.
* University degree in a technical field (physics, optics, precision mechanics, electronics, chemistry, etc.), or a combination of education and experience that demonstrates the required skills
* Identify, recommend and prioritize improvements to the customer experience, as well as internal process improvements and work with appropriate internal & external partners to implement
* Delta V or other control software experience is a plus.
* Outstanding teammate, who can work with counterparts and customers across the world.
* Self-motivated, self-starter with strong communication skills.
* Sophisticated knowledge of Microsoft Windows operating systems, PC hardware and desktop application products.
* Well oral and written English skill.
* Able and willing to travel extensively.
* Minimum of two years of experience in cell culture, fluorescence microscopy, flow cytometry and other relevant techniques desired

title: Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer till Gradientech
description:
**Hos Gradientech får du möjlighet att ta ansvar för kvalitetssäkring av bolagets samtliga mjukvaruprodukter samt interna mjukvaruverktyg. Hos Gradientech får du inte bara en chans att vidareutvecklas professionellt, utan också möjligheten att göra verklig skillnad i kampen mot antibiotikaresistens och förbättra patientvården över hela världen.**

 **Om teamet & rollen**  

Gradientech är idag omkring 40 anställda varav cirka hälften ingår i utvecklingsteamen. Du kommer att arbeta nära och tillsammans med utvecklare och QA/Reg i agila team för mjukvaruutveckling och systemutveckling. Du kommer rapportera till bolagets CTO. Gradientech har kontor och produktionslokaler belägna i Uppsala Science Park. På Gradientech jobbar man från kontoret.


I rollen som Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer kommer du ha stor fokus på kvalitetssäkring av mjukvara kopplad till bolagets IVD-produkter, på instrument- och på applikationsnivå. Det innebär att du kommer delta i test, verifierings- och valideringsarbete inför frisläppning av mjukvara. Du kommer även att delta i kravinsamling och kravanalys för utveckling av befintliga och nya produkter. Samt delta i aktiv dialog med slutkunder och/eller studiepartners för att föreslå nödvändiga förändringar/förbättringar.


Utöver detta kommer du även ha fokus på:

* Arbeta riskbaserat och kvalitetsmedvetet med utgångspunkt från ISO13485, IEC62304 och ISO14971 samt tillämpliga guidelines från FDA.
* Delta i arbete med att säkerställa cyber security inom ramen för CE-IVDR och FDA.
* Arbete med bolagets lösningar för continuous development/deployment/integration. Där ingår verktyg för test, frisläppning och distribution av mjukvaruprodukter.

  


  

**Om dig**  

Vi söker dig som har:

* En ingenjörsbakgrund alt systemvetare
* Erfarenhet av rollen som mjukvarutestare där du skrivit krav, satt upp automattester och jobbat med kvalitetssäkring
* Ett intresse av den övriga kvalitetssäkringen
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på engelska och har god förståelse för svenska språket


Vi ser det som meriterande om du har jobbat med test inom medtech alt liknande branscher där det är högt ställda kvalitetskrav.


Som person gillar du utmaningen med att arbeta i ett mindre bolag, något som erbjuder korta beslutsprocesser, oändlig utvecklingspotential, omväxlande arbetsuppgifter och ett stort eget ansvar. Rollen ställer höga krav på din noggrannhet, analytiska förmåga och samarbetsförmåga då du ingår i många olika samarbeten internt.

 **Om** **GRADIENTECH**  

Gradientech utvecklar och säljer ett CE-märkt diagnostiksystem (IVD) för antibiotikaresistensbestämning (AST) avsett för kliniska mikrobiologilaboratorier. Vårt AST system kan inom 2-4 timmar diagnostisera vilken antibiotika en patient bör behandlas med och är det idag snabbaste på marknaden för sepsisprover. Systemet marknadsförs under varumärket QuickMIC och består av en instrumentenhet med dedikerad analysmjukvara och tillhörande engångsprodukter – antibiotikakassetter. Försäljning i Europa sker via nära samarbete med specialiserade distributörer. Gradientech arbetar i ett reglerat kvalitetsledningssystem och är ISO13485 certifierat för IVD produktutveckling, tillverkning och försäljning.

 **Välkommen med din ansökan!**  

Tror du att detta skulle passa dig, eller kanske någon du känner? Vi har ett löpande urval och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag, tveka därför inte - utan skicka in din ansökan redan idag!


Rekryteringen kommer hållas av Ed:Za Group. Har du några frågor eller funderingar relaterade till tjänsten och processen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta oss på charlotte.hoffstrom@edzagroup.se

title: QUALITY ENGINEER
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**
------------------



Quality Engineers are required to write test conditions, create test scenarios, test data and test cases, execute test cases, record results, and collate test outputs to provide evidence either to enable tests to be repeated, to provide diagnostic information to assist in defect investigation, or to provide a formal audit trail of compliance to specification. A Quality Engineer identifies and delivers automated testing solutions as part of their work using their knowledge of test automation frameworks and best practice approaches. The Quality Engineer is responsible for the design, delivery, execution, and maintenance of automated test scripts, reporting outcomes to test management.


* Champion Roq QE Ecosystem and our QE Principles
* Perform bottom-up analysis on systems or system components
* Work closely with Business Analysts, technical resources and Subject Matter Experts to ensure test specification is appropriate and gives desired coverage
* Design and create test cases and test data, tracking test cases against requirements
* Design, build and maintain automated test solutions using standard industry tooling
* Utilise and champion Roq bespoke automation accelerators
* Work collaboratively with business personnel particularly around supporting execution for testing phases such as UAT and Live Proving
* Create and maintain detailed test execution schedules for individual components
* Carry out structured test execution across one or more test phases, including functional automation, exploratory and static testing
* Record test results and collate appropriate test evidence
* Raise and re-test defects
* Any other duties deemed necessary by the company


**WHAT WE LOOK FOR**
--------------------


**PASSIONATE**


* A keen interest in automated testing and delivering working software
* A working knowledge of test automation frameworks
* An appreciation of the test automation tools market (as well as supporting tools) and their appropriate usage
* An evangelist for recommended testing practices and quality engineering


**EXCELLENCE**


* Knowledge of various development methodologies (Agile/Waterfall/Hybrid)
* Demonstratable object-oriented programming skills (Java or C#)
* Ability to support the creation and maintenance of automation frameworks following best practices
* Experience working in a Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) environments
* Proven experience of working in a test automation role


**COMMITMENT**


* Experienced in Page Object Model and Object-Oriented programming
* Knowledge of a range of test automation tools, and where appropriate the ability to influence tool choice
* Awareness of design patterns and approaches to test automation

**STRAIGHT TALKING**


* Ability to communicate with clients to support their requirements and challenge where appropriate
* Able to mentor team members and anyone wishing to upskill in test automation
* Strong verbal and written skills
* Proven stakeholder management skills

**DESIRABLE**


* ISTQB Certified Tester Foundation Level
company_description: Our UK-based world class Test Lab enables us to deliver strategic software testing solutions that make a genuine difference to our clients.

title: Software Engineers - Frontend (JavaScript/React)
company_industry: Computer Games, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
**Contract** 
 : Permanent.
   

  

**Location** 
 : Sweden (within 1-2 hours of Stockholm preferred, but not a requirement).
   

  

**Work model** 
 : Fully remote, or hybrid/on-site at the Stockholm office
   

  

 We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists, experience originators, innovators and so much more. We believe amazing games and experiences start with teams as diverse as the players and communities we serve. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination.
   

  

 At our core, Electronic Arts is a game maker that connects hundreds of millions of players from around the globe to some of the world's greatest games. The EAX team is driving the strategy and implementation of important projects for EA's community of players to connect them to one another and to the games they love to play.
   

  

 Our work impacts all EA games such as FIFA, Battlefield, Madden, and Apex Legends to name a few.
   

  

 The team you will work in is responsible for in-game experiences, used by multiple game teams in their games. One example is our cross-platform social overlay, recently released in FIFA 23.
   

  

 The team is distributed and working from home, but you have the option to work from the Stockholm office if you prefer.

title: Senior Backend Engineer, Search Platform
description:
**Job Description**
 The Search Platform engineering team of Wolt is focusing on developing venue & item search for our consumers. This team is all about experimenting, testing, and fine-tuning our complex search feature, including filtering and sorting, relevancy scoring, as well as taking care of the end-to-end consumer search architecture to create the best possible search experience for our customers. The team is back-end focused and consists of a Team Lead and experienced software engineers.
   

  

 As a Senior Backend Engineer at Search Platform, you’d get a unique chance to bring your competence and experience from building similar search features in scale into use. Together with the experienced, small but growing team, you’d have full ownership of the search feature, used already by 10+ million customers. This role would be primarily hands-on developing high-quality code. In addition to programming, you’d share the best practices, ensure the building of scalable solutions, and share your expertise relentlessly around the search domain. Your handprint would surely be visual in producing an uncompromisingly good search feature which we are almost building from ground up. With Wolt expanding beyond restaurants enabling several kinds of Retail experiences, it becomes increasingly important and challenging for us to help consumers find what they need. A universal Search feature sits at the center of the organization’s wider product strategy.
   

  

 Feel free to check the Wolt Tech Blog for more read about our culture & technology here.
   

  

 📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm. Read more about our remote setup here. If you live outside of these countries - don't worry! We provide relocation support to help you make your way to Finland, Germany or Sweden.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 We are looking for a talented individual with experience in developing large-scale search features and a strong background in designing and building high-quality software. Ideal candidates will have expertise in Elasticsearch or similar tools and preferably have held a Senior Engineer role in the search domain at a large consumer organization. Experience as a coding architect is also highly valuable. 💻
   

  

 In addition, experience in site reliability engineering, including building and integrating tools for observability, logging, and monitoring, is highly desirable. ✨
   

  

 Our team primarily uses Python (Flask, FastAPI), but we value skills in any modern language and framework. If you have up-to-date expertise, you’ll fit right in.
   

  

 We value excellent communication skills, the ability to lead with technical expertise, and a strong drive to achieve results. 🚀
   

  

**Next Steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Sandra (sandra.weigt@wolt.com).
   

  

**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

**Working in Product Development at Wolt**
 At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

 The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

 Join us today to build Wolt together.

title: Senior Backend Engineer (C# & AWS)
description:
Northmill Bank is a pioneering financial institution at the intersection of technology and finance, committed to revolutionizing the way people manage and protect their financial well-being. We are creating a different kind of banking experience,
 **digital yet personal** 
 .
   

  

 Northmill Bank was founded in 2006 and have grown to over 170 employees in 4 countries, 2.500 merchants and 600.000 end users. We use the latest technology to develop safe, smart, and user-friendly products for our customers. They are the sole reason why we do what we do. We are a product company where technology is the driver to create smarter banking products.
   

  

 Grab this opportunity to be a part of us and our journey!
   

  

**The Scope Of Your Role**
* As a Senior Backend Engineer, you will take part in the process of the design and development of modern financial applications.
* You will develop advanced monitoring systems used in running operations in the AWS cloud environments.
* You will have an impact on our applications by working closely with businesses and clients who use our banking products.
* You will work with C#, .NET, ASP.NET, AWS ( incl. fargate, lambda, S3, event bridge), Jira, Confluence, Git, and Rider/Visual Studio.
* You will use DDD and CQRS.


**Required Qualifications**
* 5+ years of commercial experience in creating web applications.
* Solid experience developing applications using C#.
* Solid experience in working with SQL databases.
* Willingness and interest to collaborate and work in a team.
* Stockholm as a place of living & SE citizenship or EES Resident status.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with software engineering best practices (code reviews, continuous integration, continuous deployment, testing).
* Exposure to Agile development methodologies.
* Familiar with Web services/web API.
* Familiar with the AWS platform.


**About you?**
 You are a creative and curious person with a genuine interest in software development. We are always looking for new knowledge and have a curiosity out of this world, we think that you have the same mindset and you are excited to read about the latest tech trends. You might also, like us, love to write nice and high-quality code.
   

  

 We hope you are not afraid to inform us about problems and have your thoughts on various solutions.
   

  

 You are a team player and used to work in an Agile environment.
   

  

 Since we are a multicultural team English is the required language.
   

  

**Fun Facts**
* A non-corporate atmosphere full of openness to innovation, improvement, teamwork, and a data-driven approach.
